attributes.action: Restart the Public Consultations on the Joint Local Plan in Stoke on Trent.
attributes.additional_details:
https://www.gov.uk/government/publications/national-planning-policy-framework--2

https://www.facebook.com/saveberryhillfieldsactiongroup/

Take a look at Save Berryhill Fields Action Group (@sbhfag): https://twitter.com/sbhfag?s=09

Please sign this petition to force the Local Authority in Stoke on Trent to engage with the people paying their taxes within the City. 
We must add value to make the City more appealing by not jumping to conclusions about future housing needs too quickly.
attributes.background:
The Joint Local Plan in Stoke in Trent has not considered the views of the mass public. 
The legal documents supporting proper public consultations and guidance on future Housings Plans and Green Space Strategies have also changed. 
The timetable needs to be restarted to align all our needs.

rejection.details:
We can't accept your petition because the UK Government and Parliament aren't responsible for the issue you raise. This is the responsibility of your local authority.

You could raise this issue with a local councillor, who represents you. You can use this page to find out who your local councillors are, and how to contact them: 

https://www.gov.uk/find-your-local-councillors 

You can petition your local authority here:

https://www.stoke.gov.uk/info/20043/councillors_and_decision-making/137/petitions
